alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 1:24PM EST until March 01 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Abrigador Trail is underwater and minor flooding of homes occurs along Abrigador Trail and Willow Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:51 AM EST Friday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon and continue falling to 10.9 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 03/09/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
